Finally, we calculated the formation energies of antisites (atomic interchange, a pair of X
Y and Y
X ), which can be obtained by the differences in energies between supercells with and without antisites. The positions of the antisites were obtained by exchanging nearest-neighboring sites under the stoichiometric condition. The generated antisites were not very stable. For most of the antisites, the energies increased by more than 1 eV, as shown in Supplementary Table 1. When Fe and O were exchanged, the structure became unstable, so that it was optimized to a perfect crystal without antisites. The high formation energies of cation antisites are reasonable because the local environments of the three types of cation sites are different in the garnet crystal structure
32 . The high formation energies of the cation antisites are also in agreement with the experimental result that Ca 3Fe 2Ge 3O 12 prefers to form the normal garnet crystal structure without inversion (exchange of cation sites)
17 . Moreover, the formation energies of oxygen antisites were larger than 5 eV, which indicates that oxygen cannot be easily incorporated in cation sites.
